website_summaries.verdict: This insulating suit keeps you warm and dry enough to continue your favorite standing water sports into the fall and winter. But the zipper configuration on its shoulders make it awkward for prone paddling.
pros: Body is made of 3 mm neoprene
Allows for great range of motion in lower body
cons: Back zipper means you will probably need help getting it on and off

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed to extend ski season
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality. Does not leak and stays dry. Sizes tend to run small, I’m 6’ 174lbs and large fits perfectly. Use primarily for water skiing and allows good freedom of movement. Hint: Use plastic grocery bags over feet and hands when putting suit on, they will slide in easily and reduce wear!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Brown

customer_reviews.title: Mostly dry
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this in Lake Washington in Seattle. Works just fine. Sometimes a tad bit of water leaks in through the neck but nothing serious. Keeps you 99% dry and is actually very warm. I use this primarily for wakeboarding. I got the XL. I'm 6' and 210 lbs with wide shoulders and a larger chest. Fits perfect. My buddy is 6'5" and 245 lbs and has used it multiple times and it fits him very well also.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Great for watersports
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this drysuit for wakeboarding and slalom skiing. It works great. It would also be great for surfing. IMPORTANT: this will leak a little around the ankles and hands, but the water is absorbed into the neoprene sleeves. My core was completely dry. I find this totally acceptable. The other o'neill drysuit I owned (boost) would not absorb water and the rider would carry any water egress inside the suit. This new design is much improved. Size is snug. At 6' 170 I wore a large.
customer_reviews.author: Jason C Zamagni

customer_reviews.title: Its amazing quality, but the suit was not for me
customer_reviews.text: Its amazing quality, but the suit was not for me. I own over 10 wetsuits for different surfing and prone paddleboarding situations. I only tried it on. The good part about this suit is that it fit great in the calves, forearms, and neck. I felt the standard drysuit zipper made the shoulders too stiff for prone paddling, but fine for standup paddling or waterskiing. Also the zipper requires a second person to help get on and off.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen LeBlanc

customer_reviews.title: Very warm drysuit.
customer_reviews.text: Great for early spring/late fall water skiing. Loose top so it's not restrictive and most importantly, dry and warm. Neck seal is not too tight so it's comfortable but will let water in on a bad fall but I can live with that. Form fitting lower body. Expensive but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas P.

customer_reviews.title: Toasty warm
customer_reviews.text: Excellent drysuit. Insulated fantastic. Hopped into 45 degree water and it was delightful. Only reason for the 4 Star review as it leeks through ankles a titch. Somewhat expected, but still would prefer to be considered completely dry.
customer_reviews.author: Jean L Kringstad

customer_reviews.title: keeps me warm and dry
customer_reviews.text: i won't have to sit out wake boarding or waterskiing in the winter thanks to this dry suit! Why did i wait so long to buy one?
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: NOT a drysuit
customer_reviews.text: O’Neill are on crack calling this a ‘drysuit’. Do yourself a favor don’t buy it if you want to stay dry.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not dry
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not a dry suit. Water penetrate the legs exactly the same as a wetsuit. Sending it back
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Water ski in the cold
customer_reviews.text: This is a warm dry suit for a cold hogh mountain lake Got to use it a few times before winter
customer_reviews.author: Nicoletta Carter

customer_reviews.title: O'Neill Drysuit
customer_reviews.text: Used once very uncomfortable. Perhaps a larger size may have worked better.
customer_reviews.author: Macayla

customer_reviews.title: Drysuit is junk. Rips tears and leaks
customer_reviews.text: 1st day worked well. 2nd day the right knee disintegrated and started to leak alot. 3red day seams started to separate. Will notbuythis againand would not recommend this junk to anyone. Ive bought 6 o'Neil suits in the last 4 years for different purposes and I wont buy oneil again. Dry suit is complete junk. Loose around neck super tight around ankles and wrists
customer_reviews.author: josh

customer_reviews.title: Game changer
customer_reviews.text: Got into 50 degree water and felt cozy! Great quality. Soooo much better than the trash bag suit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it is not really a dry suit
customer_reviews.text: I am a short line slalom skier and every time I stop and start some water gets into the suit at neck and legs. The suit fits tight but I had to put some velcro straps around legs in order to avoid water coming in. The suit is OK for skiers who get one time into the water and stay on top of it. Years ago a similar suit, a semidry suit, was produced by Skiwarm-sahara.
customer_reviews.author: Ulrich Batz

product_meta.title: O'Neill Men's Fluid 3mm Neoprene Drysuit
product_meta.description: O'Neill's Fluid Neo Drysuit offers the perfect combination of flexibility and warmth with 3mm Fluidflex 2 neoprene throughout the suit. The Fluid Seam Welded construction, 100% horizontal back-dry zipper, and smoothskin neoprene neck seal and cuffs will ensure that no water enters the suit. Loose-fitting upper allows for easy layering underneath, while performance-fitting lower provides a snug fit to keep you warm and dry.
feature_bullets: Loose upper fit and performance lower fit
